title: Fantastic, just great. SOLID 5 stars
comment: Running this on my new Nexus 6, and used it to identify a number of things that were eating up the battery. Now, my battery use during a normal work day is about 1.5% per hour. It's higher at evenings & weekends (when I am "playing" on the phone) but even then, it's not bad. I also have it on my older Nexus 7 tablet. True story...I noticed that the tablet seemed to be losing charge rather quickly. Used BBS to set a custom reference point, then left the tablet with screen off overnight (that is, it was not being used at all). Next morning I saw that the tablet was getting ZERO "deep sleep", and about 90% of the time it was active, at 51MHz. So then I used BBS to investigate - found & corrected the problem (for some reason, it was trying to connect to a cellular carrier, even though the tablet has no cellular radio!!) -- now the unused tablet is in deep sleep about 92% of the time, and battery drain is VERY slow!!
Loved it
Wish kitkat didn't force you to root phone or else lose important functionality.  Will still use it.

title: No root + KitKat + BBS = Some features unavailable
comment: Loved this app on my previous phone, but on latest phone (OnePlus One, running CM11S 4.4.2), at first I got a "Failed" message in response to the "Install as System App" prompt. Turns out Android 4.4+ necessitates root for all of BBS' features to become operative. (Not developer's fault; blame Google...)  READ THE DEVELOPER'S FAQ FIRST BEFORE INSTALLING!  Note: "Refund" feature was not available in Google Play store, even immediately after purchase, for this app. (Why?) Oops!  (Edited review to reflect belated reading of KitKat-related FAQ and also excellent response from developer in helping me. I never wanted a refund; only more time to figure out what I needed to know before installing!)
Getting a refund is a feature implemented by Google and has nothing to do with the app. After exchanging a few email I think we got things settled.

title: Excellent & Valuable Info Within Hours
comment: Firstly, this is a tool which records data. It does not save you battery but offers you potentially valuable information to tweak your phone (using other tools) to gain extra battery when your device is idle.  The only flaw, is the app's output complexity. This is not for the average user but the ones willing to get their hands dirty and do some reading before tweaking their device. Making this universally friendly is a huge task, possibly impossible. However the amount of information beyond just the app recording Android's activity is impressive. Nonetheless, an absolute must forgetting the most out of your battery. Clicking on the common battery-hogs will result in a link to a wiki-like page describing what that service does. This extra information supplied is invaluable making it an excellent "5-star" app. Cheers.  Those complaining about returns, most apps have this.

title: Decent but flawed.
comment: There needs to be better control over the timespan and data presented to you.  Right now as it is, if something drains your battery dead, this app wipes all data that would help you find out what drained it. Why? Because the dev seems to think its smart to wipe all data after a reboot/unplug.  Well when your phone dies, you get both reboot and plug to charge, thus resetting all the data. How about you let us determine when we want to discard/reset data? Even a simple start/stop timer would be great.

BBS uses passive monitoring and for that it relies on Android's internal counters (userland and kernel). Those are reset at reboot so there is really nothing that can do to show data for a period before/after a reboot.

title: at least it helped to narrow it down!
comment: Much along with others the app it's on the technical side of things, nothing you can't google though to help educate you on what certain processes are. It's quick and accurate to update and I spent a lot of my time in the partial wakelocks tracking down why my SG3 with CM10.1 nightly started chewing battery like it was the end of the world. Through this It was found and as suspected LocationManagerService was the issue which solved half of my problems of what I thought was the problem. Through an adb shell dump I was able to narrow it down further. With the suspect app removed now, I have been able to confirm through BetterBatteryStats that my phone is happily in deep sleep!

title: Excellent
comment: This is an excellent app. Although it's a bit tricky to use well (it's quite technical and the "How to..." instructions are three touches away from the main screen) it allows you to see things in great detail, and therefore isolate problems precisely. So it's well worth the investment of your time and money.  My story: I suddenly found my phone battery drained very quickly. With this app I eventually isolated the problem to the pre-installed gallery app (which I never used) waking up and trying to sync every few minutes to Picassa (which I never used). The sync was due to new Google account I'd added, and which had a default to sync to Picassa. I switched off that option and now my battery seems to last at least twice as long. With minimal use it seems to last over two days. An amazing change.

title: Thank you Better Battery!
comment: I've been loosing around 15% of my battery life with my phone in my pocket supposedly doing nothing.  I charged my phone, unplugged it and let better battery watch what was going on.  An hour later I discovered that my phone was only in deep sleep 60% of the time, mostly because MLB At Bat was waking my phone up to check scores all the time.  Killed that app and I've got my phone up to around 95% deep sleep time and around 5% of the battery used per hour in idle.  All in a few hours.  Thanks Better Battery.    Warning.  The app and manual are both full of serious "Geekspeak".  It is not friendly to "Normals".  If you are not a geek get a friend to help you figure out this app.  Charge your phone, let Better Battery do it's thing for a few hours, then go to your friend and let your friend figure out the results of your test.

title: Kernel wakelock viewer solved my battery problems
comment: I have an Asus Transformer, and it was draining battery even through it was in flight mode, and the Battery Usage screen indicated that the device wasn't awake. But on BetterBatteryStats, it showed that the device was awake for a day (!) Partial wakelock showed nothing suspicious. Viewed Kernel Wakelock and sd_delayed_work was causing the device to be awake all the time. Googled it, found literally nothing. So I tried removing my SD card, and the battery drain was gone! So it was probably faulty and causing the battery drain. No other apps can show kernel wakelocks, so buy this app if you really need that. Interface is ugly and clunky, but hey, it works. tl;dr: pointed battery drain to a hardware problem. Other features are kinda meh.
